snippet: Big banks have gone from being viewed as national champions — proof of a country’s standing in the world — to being seen as a potential source of national disaster.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low finance column holds that flurry of massive fines for big banks, culminating in $13 billion penalty for JPMorgan Chase, indicates lasting suspicion following financial crisis; notes that banks have gone from being viewed as national champions to a potential source of national disaster.
lead_paragraph: Big banks have gone from being viewed as national champions — proof of a country’s standing in the world — to being seen as a potential source of national disaster.

headline.print_headline: It’s Hard to Summon Sympathy for Big Banks
headline.main: It’s Hard to Summon Sympathy for Big Banks
